decision_makers.query: Abbey Capital decision makers executives leadership team partners directors investment committee
decision_makers.tavily_answer: Tony Gannon leads Abbey Capital's investment committee; Patrick manages risk, Rory oversees Treasury operations, and John directs research. The firm is based in Dublin and focuses on managed futures.

sources.title: Our People - Abbey Capital
sources.content: Patrick is responsible for building a culture of risk management at Abbey Capital, leading our work to monitor, anticipate and respond to risks. Rory leads the team responsible for developing and supporting our Treasury, Reporting, Fund Operations & Devops systems. As Director of Research, John oversees Abbey’s investment process end-to-end, including manager analysis and due diligence, quantitative research, portfolio construction, market analysis and liquidity management. The information contained herein is not intended to and shall not in any way constitute an invitation to invest in any of the funds managed by Abbey Capital. Prospective investors should consult with their own professional advisors before investing in any of the funds managed by Abbey Capital.

investment_gaps.query: Abbey Capital investment strategy gaps opportunities sectors missing from portfolio whitespace
investment_gaps.tavily_answer: Abbey Capital's portfolio lacks investments in social housing and rural development sectors. Opportunities in these areas remain largely unexplored. Focus on sustainable and community-driven projects could fill gaps.

sources.title: [PDF] Impact Investing in Social Property: A Case Study of Cheyne Capital
sources.content: It further examines the challenges that Cheyne Capital faced as a new social landlord, particularly those relating to inefficiencies in building procurement, its need to develop a viable real estate scheme and its pledge to demonstrate a measurable social impact, alongside a financial return, for each investment. **Keywords:** impact investing; impact real estate; social housing; sustainable real estate; architecture; hedge funds; building procurement; public-private partnerships; social impact measurement; Social Investment Finance Intermediaries (SIFIs) Jarvis, Serena, Impact Investing in Social Property: A Case Study of Cheyne Capital (2021).
